intro: [WRONG START] Orchis × ulehlau, commonly known as the hybrid orchid, is a natural hybrid between Orchis morio and Orchis ustulata. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, violet or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is found in parts of Europe. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces a single spike of flowers with a distinctive hooded lip. Orchis × ulehlae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens.
